Where_will_it_take_place__1: All of Wellington City; Berhampore; Miramar; Mt Cook; Newtown
Other_Specific_Group: Refugees and migrants who speak English as a Second Language
Outcome_1: 80% of learners enrolled at the beginning of each course complete the full course or leave for employment or a higher level course. (Some students repeat a level if they have low or disrupted education in their home country or in a refugee camp)
Outcome_2: 75% average attendance rate. (Note: attendance is often a challenge for new settlers, particularly as they have many other appointments with GPs, Work and Income, public health for vaccinations, children’s schooling, etc.)
Outcome_3: 90% of learners surveyed at the end of each course in the Beginner English programme report that they are happy or very happy with their learning experience.

Project_Event_Title: The Pablos Artist in Residence programme and ROAR! gallery exhibition fund.
Outcome_1: The Pablos Artist in Residence programme encourages integration and partnerships between Pablos artists and the wider New Zealand arts scene while promoting social inclusion. We hope this can continue being an annual event.
Outcome_2: It will provide an invaluable experience for our artists in terms of career development, role modelling, mentoring and exposure to new and varied art mediums, and can lead to the production of exciting new works or group collaborations.
Outcome_3: Benefit artists currently working out of Creative Spaces. We are focusing on creative spaces because we see the value in closer partnerships with similar organisations as well as the wide range of unique artistic talent currently at these spaces.
Outcome_4: Through introducing artist lead workshops at Pablos and the success we’ve seen them have has inspired us to share this experience with other artists from creative spaces and give valuable art tutoring access people who have limited opportunities.
Outcome_5: Create an exciting & diverse exhibition calendar including a varied programme of inclusive workshops for individual, group/collaborative projects. To actively cultivate Wellington audiences who are enlightened by art that sits outside conventional realms.

Project_Event_Title: Latin American & Spain Film Festival (via Embassy of Chile in New Zealand)
Outcome_1: Over the years, the Festival has been growing in size and in attendance around New Zealand. In 2013, an estimated 4000 people attended the festival as a whole. For the 2014 edition we expect that more than 5000 people attend the Festival.
Outcome_2: In 2013 LAFF included movies from 9 countries. The the 2014 Edition we confirm the participation of 12 countries. Argentina, Brasil, Chile, Colombia, Cuba, Ecuador, El Salvador, Mexico, Peru, Spain, Uruguay and Venezuela.
Outcome_3: In order to make it even more accessible to the public, the Festival is now going to have free admission and should thereby attract those people who in the past might not have been able to attend more than one or two screenings due to the ticket costs.
